comment.body: Had the same problem on hetzner server. There is a workaround for this on the web , the problem is that IPFS is looking for peers inside the datacenter wick make you looks like you are scanning internal infrastructures of the provider and they are VERRY sensitive to this.

==== their mail ====

>On 16-07-31 06:27 PM, network-abuse@hetzner.de wrote:
> Dear Frederic Guilbault,
>
> We have indications that there was an attack from your server.
> Please take all necessary measures to avoid this in the future and to solve the issue.

==== my answer ====
>Hi, thoses logs are ligitimate IPFS traphic. It's not an attack of anykind.
>
>Looks like im not the first to run into this. Therefor I applied the following
>suggested workaround:
>
>https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipfs/issues/1226#issuecomment-120494604
>
>I hope the things will be ok with you.

-fred"


...and they never replyed, so I guess it was ok for them.
